commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented skeletal working version to start, run (echo user input), and exit program.
Added chatbot customisation
Fixed bug where program does not truly exits upon saying "bye". Extracted out command detection. Added new UNKNOWN state.
Added support for various exit keywords. Adjusted program loop exiting.
Implemented list feature (detect state, add to list, read from list). Added LIST state, Changed EHCO state to ADD State. Enhanced state detection (lower first, first word only).
Enforced requirement of a "add" keyword for adding to list.
Converted ArrayList<String> to ArrayList<Task>
Added functionality for marking and marking task
Optimised & merged mark and unmark code. Added comments for future exceptions to watch for.
Implemented subclasses of Task (Todo, Deadline, Event)
Updated "add" to "todo"
Updated UI message for todo task, extracted certain print message into functions.
Implemented support for deadline- and event- typed tasks
minor changes (added comments, moved State into `Duke` class)
Added automated testing for UI (note, user input is not part of expected output). Had to clean up ending space of the logo
Added DukeException class
Implemented code to handle various exceptions.
Implemented functionality to delete task
Made Duke static methods private. Implemented default case for program loop.
Move some Duke related methods from static context into a instance context
Implement basic writing of data (in CSV format) to data file upon task creation and program exit
commitResults.messageBody:
To do:
 * implement reading from data file during program startup
 * save to file during mark/unmark/delete
 * extra: add a "save" command to allow user to save manually

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolve some issues mentioned in PR reviews
Add Javadoc for overridden Applications methods
Add assert statement to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Components of class instance are assumed to exist prior to usage.

Such assumptions may not hold true, since code changes may
unknowingly remove such components.

Assert statements helps to ensure that important assumptions
holds at various points of the code.

Let's add assert statements to ensure that components of the class
instance are not null before interaction with that component.

Using assert statements is preferable since the programmer is
responsible for the validity of the components.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert statements to ensure string validity
commitResults.messageBody:
Date/Time parser assumes string inputted is not null and contains
some non-whitespace text.

Existing checks to ensure the string validity prior to
passing/calling to parser may unknowing be modified or removed.

Let's add assert statements to ensure the validity of the string
before starting to parse.

Using assert statements here ensure the integrity of the string,
and can prompt for proper user-input checks further up the
abstraction.

commitResults.messageBody:

Add assert statement to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Components of class instance are assumed to exist prior to usage.

Such assumptions may not hold true, since code changes may
unknowingly remove such components.

Assert statements helps to ensure that important assumptions
holds at various points of the code.

Let's add assert statements to ensure that components of the class
instance are not null before interaction with that component.

Using assert statements is preferable since the programmer is
responsible for the validity of the components.

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract Task related classes into a .task sub-package
commitResults.messageBody:
Task related classes are not categorized into its own sub-package.

Putting the classes into its own sub-package provides better
organization and abstraction.

Let's move task related classes into its own .task sub-package.
Accordingly, update access modifiers of methods of these classes.

This is related to A-MoreOOP and A-Packages in week 3 tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change toString() of tasks sub-classes to use String.format
Fixed minor bug
Improve code quality by refactoring some code
commitResults.messageBody:
Code may be generally hard to read or have unsafe practices.

Let's improve code quality through the following refactors:
* Abstract inline method call
* Clarify and improve code comments
* Consolidate duplicate conditional fragments
* Remove unused variables and code blocks
* Rename method name for more clarity
* Replacing magic literals

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert statements to ensure string validity
Replace Magic Literal, Add "default" branch, Add javadocs comments.
Spilt Duke.executeCommand into sub-packaged classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke.executeCommand is a very long method (~180 LoC).

A long method makes it very hard to debug, and will become a even
bigger problem as more features are added.

Let's
* extract method
* functionally split the method into various classes

By using classes, additional features would just add more classes,
hence reduce code clutter.

Some other methods were modified to keep the program features
working. Implementation of some methods where improved.

Bugfix: Remove incorrect assert
commitResults.messageBody:
Assert to ensure that something is written to file.

We need to consider the situation when user deletes all tasks.
Then task list will be empty (is valid state), meaning there is
nothing to write to file. This falsely fails the assert.

Let's remove the assert.

In general, we should writing a blank to a file.

* A-MoreTesting:
  Add JUnit tests for Command class.
  Make tests write to a different save file.
  Add JUnit tests for TaskList. Add and fixed guard clauses.
  Use a dummy Task instead of Todo in JUnit tests
  Add JUnit tests for Duke

JUnit test are not created for individual Command subclasses,
as they rely on Duke to work.
However, Duke is too complex to be mimiced by a stub.
Let's test individual Commands during in integration testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Bugfix: Resolved missing GUI response for unrecognized inputs
Handle exceptions due to date/time parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
Parsing of date/time is not handled and expects user to always
provide date/time in the correct format.

Fatal if not followed. Wrong format will case the program to crash.

Let's finally handle the exception by prompting user to re-type
using the correct format, and not crash the program (fatal).

Also conform to coding styling.
